intro: Myrcia calyptrata, commonly known as the red myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a distinctive, aromatic scent. Myrcia calyptrata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade.
